pull.title: [0.16] Fix crash bug with duplicate inputs within a transaction
pull.body: This is a backport of #14247 to 0.16.

repo.name: bitcoin
repo.description: Bitcoin (dont fork from here, fork from bitcoin/bitcoin)

events.message:
Fix crash bug with duplicate inputs within a transaction

Introduced by #9049
[qa] backport: Test for duplicate inputs within a transaction

events.body: Travis failure is mkdir: cannot create directory ‘/home/travis/build/bitcoin/bitcoin/depends/built/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/native_ccache’: Permission denied which is pretty clearly unrelated, though not sure exactly what the issue is. I presume some cache has garbage in it.
Don't worry about the travis issue. The cache is corrupt for months on that branch.
utACK d1dee205473140aca34180e5de8b9bbe17c2207d. The first commit is a clean cherry-pick, haven't looked at the test changes too closely.

issue.title: Updates from Bitcoin 0.16.2 - 0.16.3
issue.body:
[0.16] Fix crash bug with duplicate inputs within a transaction
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14249

[0.16.2] Backports
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13455

0.16: Remaining backports for 0.16.2
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13644

build: Bump version to 0.16.2
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13678

[0.16] bitcoinconsensus: invalid flags should be set to bitcoinconsensus_error type, add test cases covering bitcoinconsensus error codes
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13797

[0.16] Make signrawtransaction give an error when amount is needed but missing
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13796

[0.16] doc: correct the help output for -prune
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13852

issue.title: Is ElectrumX affected by the Bitcoin Core DDoS + inflation bug?
[z2.0.x] Fix crash bug with duplicate inputs within a transaction
[z3.x] Fix crash bug with duplicate inputs within a transaction
Check for duplicate inputs during block check.
issue.body:
This is a downstream fix from Bitcoin. Bad actors could create a block
with duplicate inputs and crash nodes.

The relevant bitcoin change is here: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14249
